Richard Stearns

Biography


Richard Edwin Stearns, born in Caldwell on 5 July 1936, is an american mathematics He won l'ACM Turing Award on 1993 for establishing the foundations for the field of computational complexity theory.
Stearns graduated in a bachelor's,in mathematics, from Carleton College in 1958. He other earned his Ph.D. in mathematics from Princeton University in 1961 after completing a doctoral thesis.
This thesis was entitled "Three-Person Cooperative Games Without Collateral".

Stearns actually is Distinguished Professor Emeritus of Computer Science at the University of Albany.

Research

Stearns collaborated with Hartmanis on the decomposition of sequential machines.
These are models of simple computers can be decomposed into a set of smaller sequential machines that accomplish the same tasks. TShis project were collected in papers and ,in 1966, were summarized in a book.
